str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
From tupto; a die, i.e. a stamp or scar; by analogy, a shape, i.e. A statue, style or resemblance; specially, a sampler, i.e. A model or instance.
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
